intro: Hordeum tetrastichum var. nudum, commonly known as the naked barley, is a variant of the barley species characterized by its reduced awns. It is a member of the Poaceae family and is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets that are usually glabrous or nearly so, giving it its common name. This variety is sometimes cultivated for its hardy nature and potential agricultural uses.
